content.body: How should issue sections be marked in bikeshed? There is [one in Web IDL](https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#idl-callback-functions) with just  `class="issue"` that isn't styled appropriately and thus reads as a (weird) normative section.
content.formatted_body: How should issue sections be marked in bikeshed? There is one in Web IDL with just class="issue" that isn't styled appropriately and thus reads as a (weird) normative section.

content.body: IIRC there's been some discussion in the past of having a method on `AbortSignal` that's like "register this handler if the signal is not already aborted, otherwise immediately call it", which is a pretty common use case (some discussion https://github.com/domfarolino/observable/issues/19#issuecomment-1698201158). anyone recall a discussion along those lines and where it could be found?
content.formatted_body: IIRC there's been some discussion in the past of having a method on AbortSignal that's like "register this handler if the signal is not already aborted, otherwise immediately call it", which is a pretty common use case (some discussion https://github.com/domfarolino/observable/issues/19#issuecomment-1698201158). anyone recall a discussion along those lines and where it could be found?

content.body: I might just be thinking of `throwIfAborted` though.
content.formatted_body: I might just be thinking of throwIfAborted though.

content.body: (note that this is basically how promise `then` works: "register this callback if the promise is not already settled, otherwise call it", modulo details about what "immediately" means)
content.formatted_body: (note that this is basically how promise then works: "register this callback if the promise is not already settled, otherwise call it", modulo details about what "immediately" means)

content.body: ah, node has `util.aborted` also, which is this but plus a weakref and in a promise form instead of registering a callback https://nodejs.org/api/util.html#utilabortedsignal-resource
content.formatted_body: ah, node has util.aborted also, which is this but plus a weakref and in a promise form instead of registering a callback https://nodejs.org/api/util.html#utilabortedsignal-resource

content.body: aha, which ultimately led me to https://github.com/whatwg/dom/issues/946

> <@kaiido:matrix.org> How should issue sections be marked in bikeshed? There is [one in Web IDL](https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#idl-callback-functions) with just  `class="issue"` that isn't styled appropriately and thus reads as a (weird) normative section.

Huh, that suggests that the WHATWG styling doesn't have styles for class=issue. (WebIDL was previously a W3C spec, which does have styling for that.)
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @kaiido:matrix.org
How should issue sections be marked in bikeshed? There is one in Web IDL with just class="issue" that isn't styled appropriately and thus reads as a (weird) normative section.
Huh, that suggests that the WHATWG styling doesn't have styles for class=issue. (WebIDL was previously a W3C spec, which does have styling for that.)

content.body: annevk: thanks for the heads up!

zcorpan: it's an interesting question whether data: URLs count as cross-origin there; Fetch doesn't consider them as such, but HTML prolly does the quirks check and gets to decide and I doubt it special cases data: URLs
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: it's an interesting question whether data: URLs count as cross-origin there; Fetch doesn't consider them as such, but HTML prolly does the quirks check and gets to decide and I doubt it special cases data: URLs

content.body: zcorpan: and it prolly shouldn't, so I guess I'd be inclined to treat it as a thing to fix in Chromium
